p: Bed bugs ( Cimex lectularius L.) are blood-sucking ectoparasites that usually feed at night [ 1]. During daytime, bed bugs remain hidden in cracks and crevices around sleeping and resting areas of its host. Bed bugs become highly active after the onset of darkness in search for a host [ 2] which they locate following visual, olfactory, and thermal signals that are detected by the sensory system located primarily on the insectâ€™s antenna [ 3]. It is during this time that insects might encounter semiochemicals and chemical insecticides.
